intro: Helicteres muscosa, commonly known as the silky helicteres, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Helicteres muscosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
